statements: We uphold the Second Amendment while recognizing the shared interest in reducing gun violence, so reasonable, evidence-based safety measures—such as universal background checks, red flag laws with due process, and secure storage requirements—should be implemented without broadly disarming law‑abiding citizens. By focusing on policies that target criminal misuse and mental-health crises, protect public safety, and preserve responsible ownership, we can respect constitutional rights while making communities safer for everyone.

Protecting public safety and respecting the constitutional right to bear arms are both essential goals; reasonable, evidence-based regulations—such as universal background checks, safety training, and restrictions on devices and individuals shown to pose high risk—can reduce violence while preserving lawful ownership. By focusing on measures that target risks rather than blanket bans, and by upholding due process and lawful use, we can build policies that honor responsible gun ownership and better protect communities.

Respecting the constitutional right to bear arms while protecting public safety requires targeted, evidence-based rules that keep firearms out of the hands of those who pose a clear risk without broadly stripping law-abiding citizens of their ability to own guns for self-defense, hunting, and sport. By focusing on background checks, mental-health interventions, safe-storage requirements, and enforcement of existing laws—while preserving due process and lawful ownership—we can reduce violence and accidental harm while honoring Second Amendment freedoms.

We can honor the Second Amendment while also protecting public safety by upholding the right to responsible gun ownership alongside targeted, evidence-based regulations that reduce violence—such as universal background checks, safe-storage requirements, and prohibitions for those proven dangerous. By focusing on measures that respect lawful ownership, improve mental-health and safety interventions, and enforce existing laws fairly, communities can work together to reduce harm without undermining constitutional rights.

We affirm the right of responsible citizens to own firearms as protected by the Second Amendment while also recognizing a shared duty to reduce gun violence through evidence-based safety measures. Common-sense policies—such as universal background checks, safe storage requirements, and targeted restrictions on high-risk individuals—can protect communities without undermining lawful self-defense and recreational use. By focusing on prevention, enforcement of existing laws, and improved mental-health and safety education, we can respect constitutional rights while enhancing public safety.
